data.name: richTextBox1.Text
data.value:
General Arrangement Details
The Superstructure of the Cable Stayed Bridge has Longitudinal Girders, Deck Slab and Cross Girders. Two planes of cables anchored from the pylons support the deck of the superstructure. The Bridge has the Central span of length 350m and two side spans of 121m having the total length of 592m. Vertical Clearance is 20.0m from HFL to Bridge Deck bottom.
The Bridge Deck carries a 7.5m wide carriageway, 1.5m wide footpaths on either side of the carriageway, Crash barriers are provided on both sides of the carriageway, forming the total width of the deck as 13.93m. Deck slab is 0.4m thick in the side spans and 0.225m thick in the centre span. The wearing coat is 65mm thick and a transverse slope of 2.5% is provided for the deck slab.
In modeling the structure the entire length of the Pylons are treated as prismatic & hollow with a wall thickness of 0.5m. It has a constant width of 5.0m in the longitudinal direction and 2.2m in the transverse direction. The space within the pylon at the top enables stressing of the cables. These cables are anchored to the walls of the pylons. Height of each Pylon from Deck level is 87.458m.
Each plane of Cables consists of 48 cables (including the Backstay Cables) anchored to deck at a constant spacing of 10.3m in the side span portions and 14m in the centre span. The Backstay Cables tie the pylon to the deck at the end of the side spans and balances the moments caused in the pylon and deck due to unequal spans. Each plane of cables consists of 48 cables (including the backstay cables) anchored to deck at a constant spacing of 10.3m in the side span portions and 14m in the centre span.
The Long Girders for side spans consists which are spaces 9.2m apart and the stiffening girder for the main span consists of two 2.0m deep steel concrete composite girders spaced 9.2m apart.
The Cross Girders are provided at a spacing of 3.433m along the longitudinal direction in the side span portion and at 3.5m spacing along the longitudinal direction is the central span.
The Analysis & Design of Abutment, Pier & Foundation are not included in the design and are to done in separate sessions using relevant design modules.
Abutment : Either end Abutments are of size 13.51m x 8.7m x 7.7m
Pier : Each pier supports 2 Pylons
Foundations : Each Pier is to be constructed on foundation of four piles of diameter 2.5m each and the length of piles is 30.673m, the pile cap is of size 12m x 12m x 3.75m
